title: Instructor Guide
text: This is a place to hold documentation on certain aspects of course structure for instructors of Stat 20.

title: 1  Slides
text:
1.1 Modifying your own slides

Be sure your personal fork of the course-materials is up to take by syncing it to the one on github.com/stat20.
Pull the most recent changes from your fork to your local machine.
Make changes to slides.qmd and save.

title: 1  Slides
text:
1.2 Publishing your own slides
Quarto Pub is a free service for publishing quarto documents, including slides, online. Start by setting up an account at https://quartopub.com/.

Once you are set up with an account, you can publish your slides by going to the terminal and running:
quarto publish quarto-pub slides.qmd
If you are not in the sub-directory containing your slides, you will either need to navigate there then run the above command or provide the path to your slides.qmd.
Your slides will open in a browser. In the menu on the right side, change the slug to be the exact wording of the topic of the day (i.e. summarizing-numerical-data).
At this point, you’re all set! You can click the link at the top to see how your slides will look once they’re linking off of the course website.

If you’d like to learn more about publishing with Quarto Pub, see the official documentation.
